meanings.definition: An inclined part of a road or railway; a slope.
meanings.sent1: The road had a gentle gradient, making it easy to walk up.
meanings.sent2: The gradient of the hill was too steep for the car to climb.
meanings.sent3: I tried to ride my bike up the gradient, but ended up walking instead.
meanings.sent4: The gradient of the ski slope was so steep, it felt like flying down.
meanings.sent5: The gradient of the path was like a gentle hug from nature.

meanings.definition: The rate of inclination or declination of a slope.
meanings.sent1: The steep gradient of the hill made it difficult to climb.
meanings.sent2: The gradient of the river was slow, indicating a calm flow.
meanings.sent3: The gradient of the cake's frosting was so perfect, it looked like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The gradient of the sky at sunset was a beautiful blend of colors.
meanings.sent5: The gradient of the music's volume increased gradually, creating a dramatic effect.
